Timer.interval

Function/Meaning
Event occurrence interval
Type
Property of Timer class (read/write)
Description
Represents the event occurrence interval. You can also set the value.
The unit is ms (milliseconds), and events occur at the specified time intervals.
The interval can also be specified as a real number. In the current version, it can be specified with a precision of 1/65536 milliseconds (values below the decimal point are rounded to this precision).
Even though it has a precision of about 1/65536 milliseconds, there is no guarantee that the event handler will actually be called with this precision. In practice, there is a jitter of about 3 to 10 ms in the timing of event calls. However, in the average and long term, adjustments are automatically made so that events occur at the interval specified by this property.
